ai.summary: A demanding 28.4 km circular hike in the UK that threads coastal paths, tidal marshes and inland lakes around Blakeney. The route offers expansive sea views, salty air and a mix of firm trails, grassy tracks and muddy sections, making for a strenuous day on foot.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly exposed coastal paths with occasional firm trails, muddy stretches across marshland, short sections of grass and boardwalks near wet areas. Expect variable footing, crosswinds, and water-logged ground after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before venturing onto marsh or estuary sections; some parts may be inaccessible at high tide. Stay on marked paths and avoid private salt marshes. Weather can change rapidly along the coast—bring waterproofs and warm layers. A long 28.4 km trek requires good fitness; carry sufficient water and snacks. Let someone know your route and expected finish time; carry a map or GPS; mobile coverage may be patchy in remote stretches.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finishes)
Extra socks and a dry bag
Sun protection for eye and skin
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) offer milder weather and longer daylight; summer provides the most daylight but can be busy; shoulder seasons can be windy and muddy.

seo.title: Blakeney Circular Walk – 28.4 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Embark on a challenging 28.4 km circular hike around Blakeney, UK. Experience coastal paths, salt marshes and lakes on this demanding day out with expansive sea views.
seo.h1: Blakeney Circular Walk – 28.4 km Coastal Hike
